ticket.title: rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String
ticket.original-body:
Running the task `test:uncommited` raises an undefined method 'map' for String, using git.
@@@ $ rake --trace test:uncommitted [...] rake aborted! undefined method `map' for #<String:0x8f3c728> ~/.gems/railties-3.0.0.beta4/lib/rails/test_unit/testing.rake:77:in `file_list' [...] @@@
My environment: @@@ $ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-07-30 revision 28788) [i686-linux] $ rails -v Rails 3.0.0.beta4 @@@
ticket.latest-body:
Running the task `test:uncommited` raises an undefined method 'map' for String, using git.
@@@ $ rake --trace test:uncommitted [...] rake aborted! undefined method `map' for #<String:0x8f3c728> ~/.gems/railties-3.0.0.beta4/lib/rails/test_unit/testing.rake:77:in `file_list' [...] @@@
My environment: @@@ $ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-07-30 revision 28788) [i686-linux] $ rails -v Rails 3.0.0.beta4 @@@

version.title: rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String
rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String

version.body: This is a Ruby 1.9 issue. Strings don't come with .map() anymore so this task always fails.
version.body-html: This is a Ruby 1.9 issue. Strings don't come with .map() anymore so this task always fails.
version.title: rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String

version.body-html:
Choose your Designer Wedding Dresses 2011 should be an enjoyable experience and that is what the bride wants big and beautiful! Every bride should receive personal attention when shopping for Wholesale Empire Waist Wedding Dresses .
Ask around and visit several stores before making a decision. Note, however, there is now a large and beautiful selection of Wholesale Flower girl dresses that can be purchased online.
Online shopping for bridal gown size could be your best bet. Styles include long or short sleeves, tight sleeves or strapless dresses nice to see a full figure and bare shoulders.
version.title: rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String

version.body:
Hi Sunny,
I have spoken to José about this issue, and although your patch does fix it, the bigger issue at hand is that this code (rake task) isn't tested at all.
Ideally the code within `def files` should be extracted into its own class which is tested and then used in this rake task.
If you are still interested in working on this patch please let me know.
Thanks
Josh
version.body-html:
Hi Sunny,

I have spoken to José about this issue, and although your patch does fix it, the bigger issue at hand is that this code (rake task) isn't tested at all.

Ideally the code within def files should be extracted into its own class which is tested and then used in this rake task.

If you are still interested in working on this patch please let me know.

Thanks

Josh

version.body:
I'm interested in working on this patch but I'm not very familiar with the Rails codebase. It might take long.
As for testing it, the tests would depend on svn and git. Is that ok for Rails?
version.body-html:
I'm interested in working on this patch but I'm not very familiar with the Rails codebase. It might take long.

As for testing it, the tests would depend on svn and git. Is that ok for Rails?
version.title: rake test:uncommitted raises undefined method map on String

version.body:
Hi Sunny,
This is a good patch to start off with.
And the tests won't need to depend on svn or git as we can stub out those parts.
Fork rails, create a new branch for what you are doing, and start making changes, if you have any questions do not hesitate to ask, you can also find me on irc in #rails-contrib.
I will leave the ticket assigned to me so I can monitor its progress.
Thanks
Josh
version.body-html:
Hi Sunny,

This is a good patch to start off with.

And the tests won't need to depend on svn or git as we can stub out those parts.

Fork rails, create a new branch for what you are doing, and start making changes, if you have any questions do not hesitate to ask, you can also find me on irc in #rails-contrib.

I will leave the ticket assigned to me so I can monitor its progress.

Thanks

Josh

version.body: Thanks Josh! Started making a few changes in a testuncommited branch. Not sure I'm placing things where they should be and feeling somewhat stuck. Guess I need to crawl through the whole Rails test suite to find similar tests.
